ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Type of Assessment
Trial type
Symbol index
Digit corresponding to the symbol
Digit response
Trial response correctness, boolean
Trial reaction time (ms)
Event triggered by the response
Notes: 1= timeout, no response until timeout; 2= keyup, keyboard keypress; 3= touchend/pointerup-touch, touchscreen touch

ElementDescription: Number of correct responses for all test trials
Number of responses for all test trials
Average reaction time of correct responses to all test trials (ms)
Median reaction time of correct responses to all test trials (ms)
Standard deviation of reaction times of correct responses to all test trials (ms)
Number of correct responses for all test trials
Participant's response device
Test's script version
Notes: DSC_TSMain.v1.Nov21 = baseline version; DSC_TSEMA.v1.Nov21 = EMA version; DSC_Main.v1.Jun21 = Other Version

ElementDescription: Flag indicating whether participant was flagged for any one of the above quality control metrics
Proportion of correct responses for 'test' trials
Coefficient of variation of reaction times of correct responses, computed as sdRTc/medianRTc
Number of correct responses per second of correct reaction time, computed as 1000*accuracy/medianRTc
Flag for invalid performance if num_correct < 6 (suggests participant not engaged with task)
Flag for invalid performance if num_correct/num_responses < .5 (suggests participant responding carelessly or guessing)
Flag for invalid performance if medianRTc < 300 ms (implausibly fast reaction time)
Flag for invalid performance if sdRTc/medianRTc > 1 (suggests participant not engaged with task)
